Burden of proof is primarily a legal notion, but it is sometimes used,
often loosely, outside the law. The notion of burden of proof is needed
within  the  law  because  law  cases  are  adversarial  and  the  court  has  to
come to a decision. Outside the law, people have a general burden to have
good reasons for what they say. That is the second part of Grice’s rule of
